Content: Google schools them again.  Microsoft is late to the party again, getting #2 for twice the price.\n

Author: far33d
Content: I think this is also a big reason why flash hasn't become more common for interfaces. It just doesn't feel like the web.

Author: far33d
Content: Planning on it. Just thought I'd toss some advice out for the whippersnappers out there :)

Author: comatose_kid
Content:
Most of the other responses deal with changes to the karma system - I'm not sure that's the only way to go.

How about placing some nice text above the comment submission field that reminds the poster to be nice, ie "Please be polite.", or even better, throw up random literary quotes about politeness/helpfulness/communities.

It would be a neat experiment to see if the ratios of mean-spirited responses to other types of comments decreased due to the suggested (mine or otherwise) changes.

Author: ereldon
Content:
this post reads like a parable, not a transcript of an actual conversation. it's cleverly crafted to appeal to anyone who 1) is not extremely wealthy and 2) has the ability to procreate.

it makes us feel better about who we already are. so maybe not parable, but movie script

Author: imp
Content: It's about time someone put together good documentation for those two.  I wonder if it will be more of a detailed reference book or a book of examples.

Author: NonEUCitizen
Content: I was thinking more along the lines of a coder I already trust...  I see stock options as a way to ensure that s/he participates in the upside.

Author: imp
Content: I suppose it makes sense for their first Silverlight project to be focused towards techies because they would be the most likely to install Silverlight.
